docs.title: My First
docs.text:
This repository is form Github. Use Put README.md can put the repository README.md file in below.

Now is the README.md of this repo below.

docs.title: Install
docs.text:
1. The Installation of mkDocs 
    $ pip install mkdocs
    After installation, check the version you installed : 
    $ mkdocs --version
    Next you can getting Started with MkDocs : 
    $ mkdocs new my-project
$ cd my-project
    Following command can be used to preview documentation on localhost. 
    $ mkdocs serve
    Open up http://127.0.0.1:8000/ in your browser. After this, while you save your changes. The browser will auto-reload and updated documentation immediately.

docs.title: Deploy on Github pages
docs.text:
1. Push all your documentation on Github

  2. Create the site\ foldfer 

    $ mkdocs build

    If you're using source code control such as git, you can add "site/" into the .gitignore, it will let the site\ folder be ignored from repository.

    .gitignore
    "site/"

    Or use the following instruction 

    $ echo "site/" >> .gitignore

  3. Site files get deployed to a branch Use the following command : 

    $ mkdocs gh-deploy
    MkDocs will build your docs and use the ghp-import tool to commit them to the gh-pages branch and push the gh-pages branch to GitHub.

  4. Enable Github Pages

    1. Go your repository Github website.
    2. Enable Repo by Settings > Pages.
    3. In the section Build and deployment, set Source to Deploy from the brance.
    4. In the next section Branch, set gh-pages /root and click save.

After the first deploy, if you just want to modify your file, only use the step 1, 2 and 3.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
• Use pip 
    $　pip install mkdocs-material
  • Set material theme in your mkdocs.yml mkdocs.yml
    theme:
  name: material

docs.title: Put README.md in page directly
docs.text:
Try to put the repository README.md file in below.

  • Enable the Snippets extension in your mkdocs.yml mkdocs.yml
    markdown_extensions:
  - pymdownx.snippets
  • Use the instruction in the your_file.md :

    --8<-- ./README.md --8<--

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Add the following lines to mkdocs.yml:

mkdocs.yml
markdown_extensions:
  - pymdownx.highlight:
      anchor_linenums: true
      line_spans: __span
      pygments_lang_class: true
  - pymdownx.inlinehilite
  - pymdownx.snippets
  - pymdownx.superfences

docs.title: Code copy button
docs.text:
• Add the following to mkdocs.yml to enable them globally :
mkdocs.yml
theme:
  features:
    - content.code.copy
    - content.code.annotate

docs.title: Other Design implementation
docs.text: Also you can use Material to design some style. like some colors, fonts, logo and so on.
